definition: trustworthy/reliable
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)

sentences.english: Ella: I dunno, I would rather hire someone I know and trust.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，我宁可找我认识并且信得过的人。

sentences.english: The desiccating machines manufactured by this factory are reliable.
sentences.chinese: 这个厂生产的去湿机质量信得过。

sentences.english: In 2010, the company was conferred with the honorable title "Reliable Product of Gansu Province".
sentences.chinese: 2010年获得“甘肃省信得过产品”荣誉称号。

sentences.english: "And can you trust your missis?" asked the other.
sentences.chinese: “那么你信得过你的老婆吗？”另一个问。

sentences.english: She is a person worthy of belief.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个可以信得过的人。

sentences.english: He may be a hick , but she can trust him a whole lot more.
sentences.chinese: 他也许是个乡巴佬，但至少是可以信得过的。

sentences.english: Find a couple of reliable pals to walk with each day.
sentences.chinese: 找到几个信得过的好朋友一起步行上学。

sentences.english: You can count on me, my lips are sealed.
sentences.chinese: 你可以信得过我，我的嘴很严。

sentences.english: The components of the same type are interchangeable, It is the trustable product for customers at home and abroad.
sentences.chinese: 同型号机件可互换，是国内外用户信得过产品。

sentences.english: He may be a hick , but she can trust him a whole lot more .
sentences.chinese: 他也许是个乡巴佬，但是至少是可以信得过的。

sentences.english: Thanks for helping, you are a real trouper .
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你的帮助，你真是信得过的人。

sentences.english: He may be a hick but she can trust him a whole lot more.
sentences.chinese: 他也许是个乡巴老，但是至少是可以信得过的。

sentences.english: If you have questions, take them to someone you trust.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到问题，不妨问问你信得过的人。

sentences.english: I trusted Max, so I lent him the money.
sentences.chinese: 我信得过马克斯，就把钱借给他了。

sentences.english: He is a person one can trust.
It is" trustworthy enterprise of quality "that Bureau of Technical Supervision of Yunfu still awards to our factory.
sentences.chinese: 云浮市技术监督局还授予我厂为“质量信得过企业”。

definition: to distrust/to be suspicious
reliable/trustworthy
to act as surety for sb/to be sb's guarantor/to stand bail for sb
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to entrust
to feel relieved/to feel reassured/to be at ease
prudent in speech
to make a decision/to make up one's mind
to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
trusty
to know what's going on
to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
to vouch for/to guarantee
see 作主[zuo4 zhu3]
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to pass on/to communicate/to transmit
